#include<stdio.h>
int f(int);
int main()
{
            int f(int);
            int b;
            b = f(20);
            printf(“%d”,b);
            return 0;
}
 
int f(int a)
{
            a > 20 ?  return (10) : return (20);
}
 
Expected output : 20
 
Rules: 
1)  U can make changes in function f only
2)  Using tertiary operator at least once is compulsory
3)  No. of lines in function f should not exceed 2
